content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-049-03-B
|Item_parent=Normal and pathological puberty
|Item_parent_short=Normal and pathological puberty
|Rank=B
|Title=Knowing the average value of pubertal growth
|Description=None
|Rubric=Physiopathology
|Contributors=
|Order=3}}
The acceleration in the rate of statural growth begins with the first signs of puberty in girls (S2), and is delayed in boys (G3). The average pubertal growth peak is 20-25 cm in girls and 25-30 cm in boys.

properties.question: What is the average peak of pubertal growth in centimeters for boys and girls?
properties.option_a: 15-20 cm for girls and 30-35 cm for boys
properties.option_b: 20-25 cm for girls and 25-30 cm for boys
properties.option_c: 25-30 cm for girls and 15-20 cm for boys
properties.option_d: 30-35 cm for girls and 20-25 cm for boys
